title: Frederick Russell Burnham
summary: Frederick Russell Burnham DSO (May 11, 1861 â€“ September 1, 1947) was an American scout and world-traveling adventurer.  He is known for his service to the British South Africa Company and to the British Army in colonial Africa, and for teaching woodcraft to Robert Baden-Powell in Rhodesia. He helped inspire the founding of the international Scouting Movement.
